\section{Module GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID}

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%%                               Functions                               %%
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

  \subsection{Functions}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:moveCircle}
    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.moveCircle \textit{(function)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{moveCircle}()

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Move the mouse in the largest circle possible for the given screen 
    resolution and continues in decreasing spiral sizes of 1 pixel. Prints 
    how many circles have been made, and how many iterations of the 
    spriral/circle have been made. Just an example of mouse movement.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.KeyBdInput \textit{(class)}|(}
\subsection{Class KeyBdInput}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:KeyBdInput}
\begin{tabular}{cccccccccc}
% Line for object, linespec=[False, False, False]
\multicolumn{2}{r}{\settowidth{\BCL}{object}\multirow{2}{\BCL}{object}}
&&
&&
&&
  \\\cline{3-3}
  &&\multicolumn{1}{c|}{}
&&
&&
&&
  \\
% Line for ??.\_CData, linespec=[False, False]
\multicolumn{4}{r}{\settowidth{\BCL}{??.\_CData}\multirow{2}{\BCL}{??.\_CData}}
&&
&&
  \\\cline{5-5}
  &&&&\multicolumn{1}{c|}{}
&&
&&
  \\
% Line for \_ctypes.Structure, linespec=[False]
\multicolumn{6}{r}{\settowidth{\BCL}{\_ctypes.Structure}\multirow{2}{\BCL}{\_ctypes.Structure}}
&&
  \\\cline{7-7}
  &&&&&&\multicolumn{1}{c|}{}
&&
  \\
&&&&&&\multicolumn{2}{l}{\textbf{GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.KeyBdInput}}
\end{tabular}

Creates a keyboard input\_I structure. wVk is the virtual keycode which 
correspond to physical keys. wScan, dwFlags and time may be left at 0. 
dwExtraInfo is a pointer to a ulong data type holding extra information on 
our action. Info on virtual key codes can be found at 
ttp://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms927178.aspx

    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.MouseInput \textit{(class)}|(}
\subsection{Class MouseInput}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:MouseInput}
\begin{tabular}{cccccccccc}
% Line for object, linespec=[False, False, False]
\multicolumn{2}{r}{\settowidth{\BCL}{object}\multirow{2}{\BCL}{object}}
&&
&&
&&
  \\\cline{3-3}
  &&\multicolumn{1}{c|}{}
&&
&&
&&
  \\
% Line for ??.\_CData, linespec=[False, False]
\multicolumn{4}{r}{\settowidth{\BCL}{??.\_CData}\multirow{2}{\BCL}{??.\_CData}}
&&
&&
  \\\cline{5-5}
  &&&&\multicolumn{1}{c|}{}
&&
&&
  \\
% Line for \_ctypes.Structure, linespec=[False]
\multicolumn{6}{r}{\settowidth{\BCL}{\_ctypes.Structure}\multirow{2}{\BCL}{\_ctypes.Structure}}
&&
  \\\cline{7-7}
  &&&&&&\multicolumn{1}{c|}{}
&&
  \\
&&&&&&\multicolumn{2}{l}{\textbf{GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.MouseInput}}
\end{tabular}

Creates a mouse input\_I structure. dx and dy are mouse coordinates. They 
can be left at 0, as can mouseData and time. dwExtraInfo is a pointer to a 
ulong data type holding extra information on our action. dwFlags is the 
click value of the virtual mouse. Info can be found at 
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms927178.aspx

Input is the final struct we use before passing the information off to the 
OS. The type field takes a 0 or 1 for mouse or keyboard respectively.

  \subsubsection{Methods}

    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.KeyBdState \textit{(class)}|(}
\subsection{Class KeyBdState}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:KeyBdState}
\begin{tabular}{cccccccccc}
% Line for object, linespec=[False, False, False]
\multicolumn{2}{r}{\settowidth{\BCL}{object}\multirow{2}{\BCL}{object}}
&&
&&
&&
  \\\cline{3-3}
  &&\multicolumn{1}{c|}{}
&&
&&
&&
  \\
% Line for ??.\_CData, linespec=[False, False]
\multicolumn{4}{r}{\settowidth{\BCL}{??.\_CData}\multirow{2}{\BCL}{??.\_CData}}
&&
&&
  \\\cline{5-5}
  &&&&\multicolumn{1}{c|}{}
&&
&&
  \\
% Line for \_ctypes.Structure, linespec=[False]
\multicolumn{6}{r}{\settowidth{\BCL}{\_ctypes.Structure}\multirow{2}{\BCL}{\_ctypes.Structure}}
&&
  \\\cline{7-7}
  &&&&&&\multicolumn{1}{c|}{}
&&
  \\
&&&&&&\multicolumn{2}{l}{\textbf{GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.KeyBdState}}
\end{tabular}

This is a C type 256-byte array used for storing the current state of our 
virtual keyboard. With the exception of toggle keys (CAPS LOCK, SCROLL 
LOCK, etc), many keys will be in the '0' state.

%%                                Methods                                %%

    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VKeyboard \textit{(class)}|(}
\subsection{Class VKeyboard}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:VKeyboard}
Our Virtual Keyboard! Takes type speed as its only (optional) argument. 
Default is 0.3 seconds.


%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%%                                Methods                                %%
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

  \subsubsection{Methods}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:VKeyboard:__init__}
    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VKeyboard \textit{(class)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VKeyboard.\_\_init\_\_ \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{\_\_init\_\_}(\textit{self}, \textit{typeSpeed}={\tt 0.3})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Init of our VKeyboard sets up an ulong for extra information provided 
    by the operating system, an Input Interface object and the virtual key 
    code table.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:VKeyboard:__str__}
    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VKeyboard \textit{(class)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VKeyboard.\_\_str\_\_ \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{\_\_str\_\_}(\textit{self})

\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:VKeyboard:translateKey}
    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VKeyboard \textit{(class)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VKeyboard.translateKey \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{translateKey}(\textit{self}, \textit{key})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Translate a virtual key code into an actual 'keyboard key'.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:VKeyboard:pressButton}
    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VKeyboard \textit{(class)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VKeyboard.pressButton \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{pressButton}(\textit{self}, \textit{button})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Takes a physical key representation (e.g. 'ESCAPE', 'UP', 'DOWN', 'v', 
    etc.) and translates it into a virtual key code for use by the OS.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VKeyboard \textit{(class)}|)}

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%%                           Class Description                           %%
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VMouse \textit{(class)}|(}
\subsection{Class VMouse}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:VMouse}
Create a virtual mouse. Click speed is the amount of time between pressing 
down a mouse button and releasing it. Default is 0.5 seconds.


%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%%                                Methods                                %%
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

  \subsubsection{Methods}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:VMouse:__init__}
    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VMouse \textit{(class)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VMouse.\_\_init\_\_ \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{\_\_init\_\_}(\textit{self}, \textit{clickSpeed}={\tt 0.5})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Init of our VMouse sets up an ulong for extra information provided by 
    the operating system, an Input Interface object and a virtual click 
    table.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:VMouse:getCoord}
    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VMouse \textit{(class)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VMouse.getCoord \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{getCoord}(\textit{self})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Gets the current mouse coordinates from the OS. Returns a POINT object.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:VMouse:setCoord}
    \index{GUIRobot \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source \textit{(package)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID \textit{(module)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VMouse \textit{(class)}!GUIRobot.Source.Virtual\_HID.VMouse.setCoord \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{setCoord}(\textit{self}, \textit{xCoord}, \textit{yCoord})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    Pass coordinates to the OS to set the mouse at the desired coordinates.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{GUIRobot:Source:Virtual_HID:VMouse:leftClick}
